Instance.description: A Super Interaction that adds constraints around terrain points with the tuned floor feature type on the lot.

TunableVariant.name: radius_filter
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, floor features will be filtered out unless they are within a radius of the radius_actor. The purpose of the radius filter is to constrain the set of found floor features only to those within a radius of a tuned participant. For example, this interaction could allow Sims only to route to leaves within the radius of a targeted leaf pile.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The radius, with the Saved Actor 1's position, that defines the area within which the floor feature is valid.

TunableEnum.name: radius_actor
TunableEnum.description: The Actor within whose radius the tuned floor feature must be in for consideration.

TunableTuple.name: routing_circle_constraint
TunableTuple.description: Circle constraint around the floor feature

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius
Tunable.description: Ideal distance for this circle constraint, points closer to the ideal distance will score higher.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also costs 0 instead of rising in cost. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, all goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will score optimially.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces. Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid. NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

TunableTuple.name: routing_facing_constraint
TunableTuple.description: Controls how a Sim must face the terrain feature

Tunable.name: inner_radius
Tunable.description: A radius around the center of the constraint that defines an area in which the Sim's facing is unrestricted.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If set then the facing constraint will have a requirement of facing away from the object instead of towards the object. This will not work if inner_radius is tuned to something other than 0 (actually > EPSILON because RelativeFacingWithCircle doesn't support invert.

Tunable.name: range
Tunable.description: The size of the angle-range that sims should use when determining facing constraints.

TunableVariant.name: subroot_index
TunableVariant.description: An optional subroot to use for facing.

TunableEnum.name: terrain_feature
TunableEnum.description: The type of floor feature the sim should route to
